benchmark_config.jira_title: Implement/Test API: PUT /1.0/kb/admin/healthcheck - Put the host back into rotation

covered: Valid Request: Tests cover successful PUT operations including idempotent scenarios with 204 and empty body.
Empty Response: Response body is empty for 204 on success (TC01).
Authorization: Tests cover unauthorized (401) and forbidden (403) responses (TC03, TC04).
Method Not Allowed: 405 when using wrong HTTP method (TC06).
Concurrency: Concurrency tests ensure safe rotation updates (TC14) and idempotency (TC02).
Retry/Transient Failures: Network interruption and retry behavior (TC13).
Timeout/Performance: Degraded system performance scenario with timing check (TC10).
Regression: Regression scenario to ensure previously fixed issue remains fixed (TC11).
gaps: Non-Existing Resource: No test for updating a host when rotation has no host or resource missing.
Partial Update: No test to explicitly forbid/allow partial field updates.
Invalid Payload: No tests verifying invalid payload content or types (i.e., 400/422).
Large Payload: No large payload tests.
Rate Limiting/Throttling: No tests for rate limiting PUT requests.
Caching Behavior: No validation of caching headers (ETag, Cache-Control).
Duplicate Submissions: No idempotence/duplicate submission test beyond idempotency checks in TC02.
Internal Server Error (500): No test simulating database failure or server error 500.
Missing headers edge cases: More coverage for header-related requirements beyond auth tokens.
Security - Header injection: While TC12 covers header payload, explicit mitigation tests not present.
recommendations: Add Non-Existing Resource test: handle 404 or appropriate error when there is no host in rotation.
Add Partial Update test: confirm PUT behavior for partial vs full updates (if applicable).
Add Invalid Payload tests: ensure 400/422 for malformed payloads.
Add Large Payload tests: ensure performance and correctness with big bodies.
Add Rate Limiting tests: verify proper behavior under high request rate.
Add Caching tests: ensure proper caching headers if relevant to healthcheck endpoints.
Add Duplicate Submissions tests: ensure idempotency is preserved under repeated PUTs.
Add 500 Internal Server Error scenario: simulate server side failure and proper handling.
Expand Missing headers coverage: test additional missing header scenarios beyond auth tokens.
Add explicit header injection risk tests to verify input sanitization.
